description: Number of distinct odd numbers formed from the digits of n.
example: a(37)=4 because we can form 3, 7, 37 and 73.
mathematica: f[n_]:=Length[Select[FromDigits/@Flatten[Rest[Permutations/@Subsets[IntegerDigits[n]]],1], OddQ]]; Table[f[i],{i,0,100}]  [From Harvey P. Dale, Jan 29 2011]
author: _Felice Russo_
